name: df-pj
body: |- wceq(cpj, cmpt(s0, universe, cin(cmpt(s1, cfv(clss, cv(s0)), co(cv(s1), cfv(cpj1, cv(s0)), cfv(cfv(cocv, cv(s0)), cv(s1)))), cxp(universe, co(cfv(cbs, cv(s0)), cmap, cfv(cbs, cv(s0)))))))
bodyPretty: ‚ä¢ proj =(s0 ‚àà ùïå ‚Ü¶((s1 ‚àà(LSubSp ` s0)‚Ü¶(s1[(proj1 ` s0)]((ocv ` s0)` s1)))‚ãÇ(ùïå √ó((Base ` s0)[‚Ü¶](Base ` s0)))))
comment: Define orthogonal projection onto a subspace. This is just a wrapping of ~ df-pj1 , but we restrict the domain of this function to only total projection functions. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 16-Oct-2015.)
